question: Dear Mina Kim,
Dear Hector,
Ms. Dyer:
Dear MedEx
Dear, Wayne
Hi Everyone,
Peter :
Dear Ms. Jennifer.

Hector Hausman wants some information about the mini coffee maker from Coffee Bug. He finds the contact information for Nancy Friesen on the Coffee Bug website. He writes an email to Nancy. Select the best option for each part of the email that he writes. Subject Line
2. Email Greeting
3. First Part
answers: I am interested in the mini coffee maker that I saw on your website. I have the following questions: Does it work overseas? Does it come in black? How can it be cleaned?

question: 3. Second Part
answers: Thank you for any information you can provide. I look forward to receiving your reply.

question: 4. Closing
6. Name
Choose the best word to complete these sentences. An __________ is the plan for a meeting.
2. A ______ is someone who attends a meeting.
3. Writing a summary of a meeting is called ________.
4. A ________ is usually held at the start of a project.
5. The goal of a _______ is to come up with new ideas and to be creative.
6. At a progress report meeting you will be expected to give ______.
7. Select all the sentences below which are guidelines for a successful meeting agenda.
answers: Send out the agenda at least 24 hours before the meeting.
Make sure each item on the agenda is clear.
Bring a copy of the agenda to the meeting.
Make sure everyone knows the purpose of the meeting

question: 8. Select all the sentences below which are guidelines for a successful meeting.
answers: End the meeting when everything has been discussed.
Send the minutes as soon as possible.

question: Instructions Choose the better sentences a or b to complete this email informing some colleagues about a meeting. 1. Subject line
2. Greeting
3. Purpose
answers: a. I want to remind you that the training on the new database will take place tomorrow.

question: 4. Details of time and location
answers: a. The training is from 8:00 a.m. – 11:30 a.m. in Room 5C.

question: 5. Meeting goal/details
answers: a. We hope to begin using the new database next month, so it’s important that all of you are familiar with the new system.

question: 6. What to do if you can’t attend
answers: b. Please let me know by the end of today if you can’t attend.

question: 7. Referring to an attachment
answers: a. Attached is the schedule for the training.

question: 8. Preparation
answers: a. In preparation, please complete the attached questionnaire.

question: 9. Closing sentence 1
answers: b. Please let me know if you have any questions.

question: 10. Closing sentence 2
answers: a. See you all tomorrow at 8:00.

question: Choose the best way to complete the following sentences . If there is something you want to talk about at a meeting you can send an email to the organizer asking to ___________.
If you can’t attend a meeting, you can send an email ___________.
Using words like unfortunately, I’m afraid and I’m sorry make the sentence ___________.
Just to let you know I can’t make it is an example of __________ language.
You should usually give a __________ reason when you are too busy to attend a meeting.
Something has come up is an example of a ___________ reason.
I look forward to reading the minutes is an example of ____________.
If you can’t attend a meeting, it is ____________.
answers: possible to ask to reschedule it, but use indirect language

question: If you need to reschedule a meeting ___________.
Same time, same place probably means ___________.
answers: maybe only the day has changed

question: Choose the best word to complete these sentences. 1. A cell phone is a telecommunications ___.
2. I’m sorry. I didn’t ___ that. Could you repeat what you said?
3. I don’t know the ___ number for our teleconference.
4. I’m having trouble logging ___ the conference site.
5. Did you send us the access ___?
6. I am ___ the results of the survey. Please look at them before the meeting.
7. I’d like to get everyone’s ___ before I make a decision.
8. Did we ___ Tina? She joined the meeting, right?
9. Use ___ if there’s a lot of noise near you when you call in to a meeting.
10. I can’t hear you clearly. You’re breaking ___.
Which of these is a good thing to do when you have a teleconference?
answers: a. Give people clear instructions for how to connect to the teleconference.
b. Call in to connect to the meeting before it is exactly the time.
a. Say “This is ... (your name)” when you join a teleconference.
b. Prepare ahead of time for the meeting.

question: Choose the better sentence to complete these minutes.

This means that we have to reconsider our plans.
The statistics show that the Market is the best place.

question: Part 1 of 2: Choose the best response to these sentences. How about a new advertising campaign?
What if we changed the atmosphere in the store?
answers: Atmosphere? What do you mean exactly?

question: Maybe we could make it lighter with more windows.
answers: Adding to that, maybe we could paint it a brighter color, too.

question: These are great ideas everyone. Anything else?
answers: I know this might sound crazy, but what about concentrating on the student market?

question: I don’t really know about this, but....

Select the 1 sentence below which is NOT necessary for successful brainstorming.
answers: Follow-up the brainstorming with an email

question: True or False: You should write a script of what you want to say and read it so your English is perfect.
You should prepare what you want to say before you make a call.
You should speak for no more than one minute .
Explaining all the details of a situation is helpful for the listener.
It’s a good idea to repeat your contact information, even if you’ve given it before.
It’s rude to tell someone that you need something soon.
You should have a goal for a business or professional phone call.
Avoid being angry in a voicemail.
Your pronunciation will be better if you read your message like a script.
If you speak quickly, your message will sound more like a native speaker and it will be easier to understand you.

answers: tell the other party it is not normal

Here is a conversation between Leon from an engineering company and Toni Zanetti from Northwestern Soul, a caterer. You will choose the best expression that fits the blank in the following questions. Toni: Hello. This is Toni Zanetti speaking. Leon: This is Leon Klinsman here from RTS Systems. I’m calling about the lunch you are catering for us today. Toni: Oh yes., Mr. Klinsman. I hope everything looks satisfactory. Leon: Actually, Ms. Zanetti. It doesn’t . Toni: ________________ [1] What is the problem ? Leon: Well, first of all we don’t have enough rolls. I think we will run out ... Toni: Umm. OK, go on. Leon: ...and there’s a mistake with the dessert. Toni: Sorry, Mr. Klinsman. ________________ [2] Leon: Well we ordered a giant chocolate mousse cake for our CEO’s birthday, and it isn’t here. Toni: Oh dear. ________________ [3] Mr. Klinsman. Toni: OK just ________________[4]... Toni: You said there aren’t enough rolls and you don’t have the chocolate cake, ________________ [5] Leon: Yes. And it’s her 50th birthday, and we wanted it to be a surprise. Toni: I see. ________________ [6] Mr. Klinsman. Toni ________________ [7]. Leon: What are you going to do about it then? Can you get another cake? Toni: Unfortunately, ________________. [8] Toni: We wouldn’t be able to get it in time, but ________________ [9] I know we made the cake. Maybe he hid it somewhere. Leon: Alright. Toni: And what if I brought over some more rolls. Maybe twenty. ________________ [10] Leon: I guess so. Toni: Alright Mr. Klinsman. I’ll call my colleague right now and call you back.

Here is a conversation between Leon from an engineering company and Toni Zanetti from Northwestern Soul, a caterer. Choose the best expression that fits the blank. TONI: Hello. This is Toni Zanetti speaking. LEON: This is Leon Klinsman here from RTS Systems. I’m calling about the lunch you are catering for us today. TONI: Oh yes., Mr. Klinsman. I hope everything looks satisfactory. LEON: Actually, Ms. Zanetti. It doesn’t . TONI: [1] ________________ What is the problem ? Select the best answer for [1].
answers: I'm very sorry to hear that.

question: LEON: Well, first of all we don’t have enough rolls. I think we will run out ... TONI: Umm. OK, go on. LEON: ...and there’s a mistake with the dessert. TONI: Sorry, Mr. Klinsman. [2] ________________ Select the best answer for [2].
answers: Could you to give me a few more details?

question: LEON: Well we ordered a giant chocolate mousse cake for our CEO’s birthday, and it isn’t here. TONI: Oh dear. [3] ________________ Mr. Klinsman. Select the best answer for [3].
TONI: OK just [4] _______________ Select the best answer for [4].
answers: let me make sure I got that.

question: TONI: You said there aren’t enough rolls and you don’t have the chocolate cake, [5] ________________ Select the best answer for [5].
TONI: I see. [6] ________________ Mr. Klinsman. Select the best answer for [6].
TONI: [7] __________________
answers: I can understand how upset you feel.

question: LEON: What are you going to do about it then? Can you get another cake? TONI: Unfortunately, [8] ________________. Select the best answer for [8].
answers: I don't think we would be able to do that.

question: TONI: We wouldn’t be able to get it in time, but [9] ________________ I know we made the cake. Maybe he hid it somewhere. LEON: Alright. Select the best answer for [9].
answers: why don't I call my colleague?

question: TONI: And what if I brought over some more rolls. Maybe twenty. [10] ________________ ? LEON: I guess so. TONI: Alright Mr. Klinsman. I’ll call my colleague right now and call you back. Select the best answer for [10].

Are the following good or bad ideas when you’re preparing to give a presentation? Choose good idea or bad idea. 1. Practice your presentation more than once.
2. Stand tall.
3. Always walk back and forth in front of the podium.
4. Don’t move your body during a presentation.
5. It’s important to read from your script.
6. Face the audience and have eye contact.
7. Speak quickly.
8. Pause before and after your main point.
9. Stress the final letter in an abbreviation where you say the letters, such as IBM.
10. Use fillers frequently instead of silence.

answers: Show the direction of your talk.

question: 5. I’m the director of the Tourism Board.

answers: Show the direction of your talk.

question: Part 2: Choose the best word to complete these sentences. 7. Raise your hands _______ you have been to a convention in the last 5 years.

Choose the best sentence to use for an effective, professional presentation. The items follow the progression of a typical presentation. Introduction to the Presentation:
answers: Good afternoon. My name is Pat Jonas. I’m here today to talk about trends in the travel industry.

question: Choose the best sentence to use for an effective, professional presentation. The items follow the progression of a typical presentation. Later in the Presentation
answers: As you know, millennials are very tech-savvy, so they use online and digital devices to research and book travel.
So, what can we do to attract their business?
I see you want to talk about this, but I have some surprising information for you. Are you ready for it?
Let’s go back a bit here. Statistics don’t always tell the whole story. What’s missing here is the increase we’ve seen recently.
Some types of travel are perfect for the person-to-person contact that an agent provides. For example, few people are want to commit to eco-travel without personal contact.
To close, here are my suggestions for each of the challenges I outlined.
And now I’d be happy to answer any questions.
I can see that you’re upset.
I’m sorry. I’m not an expert in that area.
First, let’s take a look at changes in the market, particularly two groups – millennials, that is, people born between 1981 and 1996, and seniors.

question: Choose the best sentence to use for an effective, professional presentation. The items follow the progression of a typical presentation. Introduction to the Presentation
answers: I’d like to start with a statistic I saw last week in the news. Did you know that only 18% of customers book their travel through agents like you ?
So in the next twenty minutes. I’m going to talk about what we can do to increase our business and to bring people back from online sites.
Here’s an overview of my talk.
We’ll have time for questions at the end.

The first thing on our a_______ is the budget.
Let’s m____ o__ to the budget.
Are we ready to m____ a d_________?
Thanks. You made a g_____ p______.
You’ve r________ an important issue.
I’m glad you b__________ that u__.
How about p__________ing this until our next meeting?
Thanks for your i________t, everyone.

I___ sure.
I ___ like we need to do more research.

answers: I don’t think it’s a great location.

question: A: Southcenter would be great. B: __.
___ we opened a smaller store?
Maybe we ___ more research before we make a decision.
A: Let’s do more research before we make a decision. B: ___.
A: A lot of tourists visit Pike Place Market. B: ___.
A: Godiva has a store at Southcenter. B: ___.
Choose the best response for the following questions. 1. It’s a difficult decision.
answers: b. Very difficult, but I have a suggestion.

question: 2. I think that Southcenter is the best place for our new store.
3. The rent is $5,000 a month. I think we should do it.
answers: a. Don’t you think that’s a bit expensive?

question: 4. It’ll be easy to find sales people because there are so many students nearby.
5. Godiva already has a store there.
answers: a. That’s true, but we’re a bit different from them.

question: 6. I don’t think we should move.
answers: a. Do you think we should wait to decide?

question: 7. It’s late, and we can’t make a decision.
answers: b. Why don’t we meet again tomorrow morning?

question: 8. We need more customers. Let’s reduce all our prices.
answers: a. Do you think we can afford that?

question: First, try to remember. What do you say if... 1. you want to know who’s in the conference call?
Second, what if... 2. you think Neil is no longer in the conference?
answers: a. Did we lose Neil? / Is Neil still on?

question: Thirdly, what if... 3. someone’s cell coverage is bad?
Again, first try to remember. What do you say if... 4. You’re late and want to apologize.
5. The screen just went blank on the web meeting site. What do you say?
answers: a. Something happened with the site.

question: 6. You want to know if everyone has access to the screen you’re looking at. What do you say?
answers: c. Can everyone see the screen?

question: What do you say if... 7. you want each person to speak for less than one minute.
answers: a. We have about one minute for each person.

question: What if... 8. you didn’t hear what someone said.
answers: b. I didn’t catch that last part.

question: 9. you’re confused about what someone meant.
answers: c. Sorry to interrupt, but I’m not sure what you mean.

Select six sentences that describe best practices for writing effective minutes.
answers: Write a short summary of what happened in the meeting.
Include action items and the date of the next meeting, if known.
Look at the agenda before the meeting.
Use a more formal tone if you don’t know your readers.
Use headings to make the minutes easy to read.
Give information about discussions in a neutral way.

question: Which choice is better for minutes of a meeting? (for heading)
Which choice is better for minutes of a meeting? (information about a discussion)
answers: The team discussed whether it was a problem that Godiva is at Southcenter.

question: Which choice is better for minutes of a meeting? (information about a discussion)
answers: Godiva’s higher brand recognition might be a problem for us.

question: Which choice is better for minutes of a meeting? (information about a decision)
answers: We decided on Pike Place Market because of potential for the high sales and increased brand recognition.

question: Which choice is better for the minutes of a meeting? (information about a survey)
answers: Tina reported on the results of the consumer survey (attached).

"Why don’t you try out our gym and see if you like it? Here’s a free 30-day pass."
